Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Blake Griffin pays $258,000/month in child support to his ex Brynn Cameron. Both Griffin and Cameron refuted this claim, stating that the reports of the financial details of their child support agreement are inaccurate.
Understate: The claim may understate the actual amount of child support that Blake Griffin pays. TMZ reported that he was paying $32,000 per month, which is significantly less than the $258,000/month mentioned in the Facebook post.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a Facebook post that cites Radar Online. However, both Griffin and Cameron have refuted the claim, and the actual details of their child support agreement remain confidential.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the information provided in the Facebook post is accurate and reliable, despite the refutations from Griffin and Cameron.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the Facebook post and the Radar Online article may have exaggerated or misrepresented the actual child support agreement between Griffin and Cameron.
